name: República dos Palmares
description:
A Tribute to Abdias do Nascimento: actor, poet, writer, playwright, visual artist, university professor, politician and activist.
Abdias believes that the quilombos, the space of black resistance on the Brazilian slave system, were the place where true democracy existed, that is, where all peoples are in fact free.
The Quilombist movement is still alive today because black people are still in a situation similar to that of the past, that is, as long as there is a need for liberation, there will be Quilombist ways of resisting.
A space of harmony and resistance typical of the context of this land, based on coexistence and ways of existing free from the illness caused by capitalism's profit and work dogmas.
All forms of resistance that seek the liberation of black and native peoples in Brazil can be considered quilombist forms of existence: African-based religions, capoeira, collectives, etc…
Abdias left a series of works guiding the Brazilian population on how a true democracy can exist, how to respect social minorities, encourage young people to imagine and build a more egalitarian future. It's Afrofuturism in practice. 
Digital Illustration, GIF, 595x752 px, Ventania, 2021,a futuistic series piece.
